name: Ramona Slug
bio: Ramona Slug explores abstract visual language through layered compositions focused on gesture, rhythm, and emotional contrast.

name: Ada Oprea
bio: Ada Oprea works primarily with photography, building narratives around character, staging, and subtle social observation.

name: Corina Eredenta Moldovan-Florea
bio: Corina Eredenta Moldovan-Florea develops textile pieces rooted in craft tradition, material tactility, and contemporary presentation.

name: Deragos Nita
bio: Deragos Nita combines painting and sculptural interventions to investigate symbolism, memory, and expressive forms.

name: Ionela Pațareniuc
bio: Ionela Pațareniuc focuses on decorative ceramics with zoomorphic references, balancing utility, ornament, and storytelling.

name: Sergiu Negulici
bio: Sergiu Negulici creates installation-based work that merges painted surfaces, spatial sequencing, and site-specific responses.

name: Amandine Banescu
bio: Amandine Banescu develops watercolor illustration projects with a focus on narrative mood, line economy, and character detail.

name: Ioana Binica
bio: Ioana Binica works with cyanotype processes, layering botanical and abstract motifs through light-sensitive compositions.

name: Rares Aron
bio: Rares Aron presents handcrafted leather-oriented pieces that highlight process, function, and artisanal precision.

name: Natasa Radion
bio: Natasa Radion creates textile works emphasizing domestic memory, personal archives, and intimate material language.

name: Selma Duteanu
bio: Selma Duteanu develops watercolor paintings built around atmospheric transitions, color tension, and layered surfaces.

name: Zelmira Szabó
bio: Zelmira Szabó explores illustration through botanical and symbolic themes, combining delicate mark-making with strong compositional anchors.

name: Iulian Milea
bio: Iulian Milea bridges visual art and instrument making, integrating sculptural experimentation with sound-oriented craft.

name: Victor Ghiga
bio: Victor Ghiga works in wood sculpture, emphasizing form clarity, hand-finished texture, and expressive volume.

name: Rodica
bio: Rodica creates handwoven textile works inspired by traditional motifs and adapted to contemporary exhibition contexts.
